Sequence Information.Source: AI predicted, Machine learning prediction fromZea mays, plants

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals this sequence is most similar (45.45%) todesigned peptide 	((RLA)2R)2L=A=W=R: 20%. GRAVY: 0.145; M Wt:  2569.131; M formula: C126H186N36O21S1; Mol ex coeff: 22200.Activity: Active against C. michiganensis subsp. michiganensis (MIC 8 uM), C. fangii (MIC 8 uM), B. subtilis 168 (MIC 16 uM), R. solanacearum (MIC 8 uM), P. syringae pv. tomato DC3000 (MIC 4 uM), P. syringae pv. syringae (MIC 4 uM), X. oryzae pv. oryzae (MIC 4 uM), X. campestris pv. holcicola (MIC 4 uM), Dickeya zeae (MIC 16 uM), P. carotovorum subsp. carotovorum (MIC 16 uM), Erwinia amylovora  (MIC 8 uM), Agrobacterium vitis (MIC 8 uM), E. coli DH5alpha or DE3 (MIC 16 uM).In vitro toxicity: murine RBC: the peptide showed a low level of hemolysis (hemo.lytic) (5% at ~100 uM) with HC50 > 500 uM.Structure: predicted to be helical.
Literature Information.Author: Hassan MF, Qutb AM, Dong W. 2021
Literature Information.Reference: Int J Mol Sci. 2021 Mar 5;22(5):2643. doi: 10.3390/ijms22052643.PubMed.
Literature Information.Title: Prediction and Activity of a Cationic alpha-Helix Antimicrobial Peptide ZM-804 from Maize.
